metadata.title: CVE-2016-6254 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the parse_packet function in network.c incollectd before 5.4.3 and 5.x before 5.5.2 allows remote attackers to causea denial of service (daemon crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via acrafted network packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6254` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

collectd - 5.7.2-2ubuntu1
collectd-core - 5.7.2-2ubuntu1
collectd-utils - 5.7.2-2ubuntu1
libcollectdclient1 - 5.7.2-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: collectd package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.7.2-2ubuntu1').
